sections.text:
## Description

## Summary
Adds an in-app admin UI in Sales_Accelerator to view and update tenant-level compliance settings introduced in GOLD-131. Includes one-click presets for common regulated configurations, end-to-end validation, and explicit user-facing messaging that explains why AI generation or comms ingestion is blocked by policy.

## What changed
- **Admin UI (Sales_Accelerator)**
  - New compliance settings screen for tenant admins.
  - Renders all tenant compliance toggles with **clear, human-readable descriptions** of what each toggle blocks/permits.
  - Supports editing + saving with optimistic UI + failure rollback messaging.

- **Presets**
  - Adds preset selector with safe defaults:
    - **Regulated / No AI Generation**: disables AI generation features governed by GOLD-131 flags.
    - **PII-Restricted Comms Ingestion**: disables comms ingestion pathways governed by GOLD-131 flags.
  - Preset application updates the local form state and shows a confirmation before persisting.

- **Validation (high priority / safety)**
  - **Client-side**: blocks invalid combinations (e.g., dependent toggles) and surfaces inline errors before submit.
  - **Server-side**: API enforces the same rules; invalid updates return structured validation errors that the UI displays.

- **Policy enforcement messaging**
  - When AI generation or comms ingestion is disabled by compliance policy, impacted entry points now show an explicit **“Blocked by tenant compliance policy”** message with the specific setting(s) responsible.
  - Adds a consistent error code/reason mapping so the UI can render “why blocked” deterministically.

## Implementation notes
- Introduces a typed settings model (aligned to GOLD-131) and a single update endpoint call used by the admin UI.
- Centralizes preset definitions in code (name, description, and toggle values) to keep behavior deterministic and testable.
- Adds unit coverage for preset application + validation rules, and integration coverage for blocked-message rendering based on server responses.

## User impact
- Tenant admins can configure compliance controls without backend intervention.
- End users get clear guidance when features are unavailable due to tenant policy, reducing support escalations.
